posts.post_content:
Give him first strike and he'll wipe your opponents board before his creatures get to deal damage.  
Maybe [Runechanter's Pike](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Runechanter's Pike)?  
  
Trample helps too, maybe [Kessig Wolf Run](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kessig Wolf Run)? or even using [Traitorous Blood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Traitorous Blood) on your own creature.

posts.post_content:
@ignaeon:   
  
Sorry to burst your bubble, but Bale doesn't go with Mage Slayer any better than any other power 6 creature. Bale's ability triggers through *combat* damage, that is, when he himself lands a strike on your opponent unblocked or through trample. Still, it's 6 damage *almost* guaranteed to slip through unless prevented.
posts.html:

Still, it's 6 damage almost guaranteed to slip through unless prevented.

posts.post_content:
It's like a built in Bonfire.  
  
Also, it may not need mentioning but I see a lot of talk about hard casting this guy. Mind you guys that in red already at the 1 slot we have [Faithless Looting](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Faithless Looting). In red's allied color of black we also have [Unburial Rites](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unburial Rites). If you can find a convenient way of generating white mana you can have him out as early as turn 5 by flashing Unburial Rites. Of course turn 4 your opponent probably has plenty of counters, bounces, and removal. By the time you manage to reach 7 mana you probably will have a better chance of keeping him around but still, can you imagine turning this guy sideways on turn 5? OUCH!  
  
@llavering71  
  
Yes, it does bypass Hexproof. Hexproof prevents creatures from effects that say " destroy target creature", "return target creature", etc. The keyword there being "target". Things that effect all creatures bypass Hexproof because they do not "target" a specific creature.  
  
The effect does NOT bypass protectio... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Of course turn 4 your opponent probably has plenty of counters, bounces, and removal. By the time you manage to reach 7 mana you probably will have a better chance of keeping him around but still, can you imagine turning this guy sideways on turn 5? OUCH!

@llavering71

Yes, it does bypass Hexproof. Hexproof prevents creatures from effects that say " destroy target creature", "return target creature", etc. The keyword there being "target". Things that effect all creatures bypass Hexproof because they do not "target" a specific creature.

Posted By: ThisisSakon (9/22/2011 6:46:55 PM)

posts.post_content:
Fair because you need to get it through. [Ancient Hellkite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ancient Hellkite) and [Flameblast Dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Flameblast Dragon) both clear their own way prior to the blocking phase, while this can be chump blocked. Of course you have the entire next turn to burn away the possible blockers before he can attack. I recommend playing him with [Soulbright Flamekin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Soulbright Flamekin) so you can get him out a turn earlier and and give him trample.   
Also, a fun target for [Zirilan of the Claw](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Zirilan of the Claw).
posts.html:
Fair because you need to get it through. Ancient Hellkite and Flameblast Dragon both clear their own way prior to the blocking phase, while this can be chump blocked. Of course you have the entire next turn to burn away the possible blockers before he can attack. I recommend playing him with Soulbright Flamekin so you can get him out a turn earlier and and give him trample.
Also, a fun target for Zirilan of the Claw.

posts.post_content: Just won a game with this by accident. I got my boros humans deck mixed up with my silly dragon deck (same color card sleeves) and I had 4 life left with nothing but weenies and tokens. My opponent had 3 black fliers tapped and 17 life. Posted By: alphagprime (9/8/2012 8:04:42 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This guy is a monster, his presence demands an answer and his art is incredible.... That being said, with all these token decks running around he needs trample for this environment, and it would have made him that much more fearsome. He would still be vulnerable to any kind of spell so it would not break anything.  
  
Of course its not hard to give him trample! Just doesn't feel right when this beastly creature gets chumped by a spirit token then you get swarm killed next turn.  
  
EDIT: Okay with the help of [Gilded lotus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gilded lotus), [Fervor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fervor), [Birds of Paradise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Birds of Paradise), I have played a hasted Balefire on turn 4!! [Kessig Wolf Run](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kessig Wolf Run) is an easy way of giving him trample.
posts.html:
This guy is a monster, his presence demands an answer and his art is incredible.... That being said, with all these token decks running around he needs trample for this environment, and it would have made him that much more fearsome. He would still be vulnerable to any kind of spell so it would not break anything.

Of course its not hard to give him trample! Just doesn't feel right when this beastly creature gets chumped by a spirit token then you get swarm killed next turn.

EDIT: Okay with the help of Gilded lotus, Fervor, Birds of Paradise, I have played a hasted Balefire on turn 4!! Kessig Wolf Run is an easy way of giving him trample.
